docs.lead_paragraph: A new study has found that blacks are far less likely than whites to get flu shots, even under managed-care health plans that provide the shots free to patients. It was already known that blacks receive fewer flu shots than whites. Experts thought the reasons might include poor access to health care, lack of knowledge or misconceptions in minority communities about the vaccinations, or even disparities in doctors' offering the vaccinations to blacks versus whites.

headline.main: Many Blacks Pass Up Free Flu Shots

docs.abstract: New study finds blacks are far less likely than whites to get flu shots, even under managed-care health plans that provide shots free; drawing (M)
